column4: is anyone aware of some good sites for starting programming in ubuntu?
start by picking a language
just pick one out of the hat eh? :P
after you've picked C, get 'The C Programming Language" the book.
If you wants something a bit easier, maybe try PHP.
If you didn't get errors it worked.
No, sumply run 'sudo nvidia-glx-config enable'
Doesn't do anything? The command just exits and prints nothing?
'sudo apt-get install nvidia-glx-legacy linux-restricted-modules-$(uname -r)-nvidia-legacy; sudo nvidia-glx-config enable'

EE NVIDIA(0) Failed to load the NVIDIA kernel module! EE Aborting! EE Screen(s) found, but none have a usable configuration.....well i have added Load "glx" and removed the dri and GLcore modules from xorg.conf and replaced nv with nvidia, and it wont start, no matter what, if i go back to the "nv" driver x starts, but no glx :(
need linux-restricted-modules-$(uname -r)-nvidia-legacy
lemme try that...
where were you 24 hours ago when know one knew how to help me?
I was here, laughing.... ;-)
bastard :P
Ya gotta take it whereever you can get it ;-)
actually, last night about this time i copied some bogus libs to /usr/libs, it was today that i had nvidia problems again :P
(but really, i was out on site fixing an Win98 machine)
